A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Left the cinema feeling like someone had punched me in my gut. Probably one of the worst experiences in my life. My reason for hating it\, isn't because it's too "bold"\, "refreshing" or "original"\, it's because of stupid directorial decisions... The Force Awakens had it's flaws\, but overall it was a decent Star Wars\, not the best\, but definitely not the worst. The last Jedi is the foundation for episode VIII\, and unless JJ works some absolute magic\, that's going to suffer as well. Here are my issues with The Last Jedi...

Terrible plot\,

Persistent childish humour\, that ruins also every scene.

Poor structure\, and pacing issues\,

Difficulty maintaining focus\,

Finn and Rose Subplot\,

Under-utilised characters

Missed opportunities - Knights of Ren\, Snoke.

Close call cliches\,

Abysmal character development 

Inconsistencies\,

Daisy Ridleys acting is very flat.
And that classic Cringe-worthy Disney ending...
Rian Johnson is not capable of directing Star Wars\, and beginning to question his ability as a director altogether. The millenniums\, and the "non-hardcore fans" will tell you that this movie is amazing\, with the exact same justification from every single one\, "It's bold\, and refreshing\, you h8ters can't be pleased".
